title: USS SC-17
text:
USS "SC-17, until July 1920 known as USS "Submarine Chaser No. 17 or USS "S.C. 17", was an <a href="SC-1%20class%20submarine%20chaser">"SC-1"-class</a> <a href="submarine%20chaser">submarine chaser</a> built for the <a href="United%20States%20Navy">United States Navy</a> during <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a>.
"SC-17" was a wooden-<a href="Hull%20%28watercraft%29">hulled</a> 110-foot (34 m) submarine chaser built at the <a href="New%20York%20Navy%20Yard">New York Navy Yard</a> at <a href="Brooklyn%2C%20New%20York">Brooklyn</a>, <a href="New%20York%20%28state%29">New York</a>. She was <a href="Ship%20commissioning">commissioned</a> on 8 November 1917 as USS "Submarine Chaser No. 17", abbreviated at the time as USS "S.C. 17".
When the U.S. Navy adopted its modern <a href="Hull%20classification%20symbol">hull number</a> system on 17 July 1920, "Submarine Chaser No. 17" was classified as SC-17 and her name was shortened to USS "SC-17".
On 24 June 1921, the Navy sold "SC-17" to <a href="Joseph%20G.%20Hitner">Joseph G. Hitner</a> of <a href="Philadelphia%2C%20Pennsylvania">Philadelphia</a>, <a href="Pennsylvania">Pennsylvania</a>.
